image.altText: a graphic of mei lin's passport photo and pictures of her home, and papua new guinea

props.synopsis: The 41-year-old businesswoman was arrested at her multi-million-dollar acreage home in Brisbane's south last month and charged in connection with an attempt to traffic drugs from Papua New Guinea into Queensland.

title.children: The AFP is alleging a mum-of-four is a key figure in a 'transnational crime syndicate'

image.altText: police tape and emergency vehicles

props.synopsis: The body of a man was located in Baulkham Hills, while two other bodies, a woman and a child, were found in North Parramatta.

title.children: Three bodies found in separate locations in Sydney including two in taekwondo studio

image.altText: Woman stands next to electricity meter box and looks at the meter readings

props.synopsis: Darwin residents report sharp increases in electricity bills after the installation of smart meters at their properties.

title.children: Kerri's power bills soared since installing a smart meter. She's not the only one

image.altText: a gas exploration site in the middle of scrub.

props.synopsis: The federal government has faced questioning over whether millions of dollars of public funds that have been handed to oil and gas companies are "valid and legal".Â

title.children: Federal government to investigate whether millions of dollars handed to oil and gas companies are 'valid and legal'

image.altText: Lightning striking a boat.

props.synopsis: As four people remain in hospital after being struck by lightning in Sydney on Monday, experts revealÂ how to stay safe if you're caught in a storm.

title.children: What happens if you are struck by lightning and how to stay safe in a storm

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair wearing a black and red patterned blazer mid-sentence on a stage pointing her finger.

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia boss Jayne Hrdlicka announces she will step down after almost four years at the helm of the airline.

title.children: Virgin Australia boss Jayne Hrdlicka to step down

image.altText: An Aboriginal man wearing a cap and blue work shirt looks at the camera in front a Tennant Creek Ranger Workshed sign.

props.synopsis: Jeffrey Curtis has been waiting a long time for a new ranger hub in Tennant Creek, but it's arrived and he's looking forward to seeing how it helps young people in the remote Northern Territory town.

title.children: No longer 'an old shed', a revamped ranger hub creates space for community and country

image.altText: truck v train 1

props.synopsis: Rail officials plead with country drivers to not take risks at level crossings as hair-raising footage emerges of a train and truck coming within "a second" of a catastrophic collision.Â  Â  Â  Â  Â

title.children: Train and truck seconds from disaster in near miss in outback Western Australia

image.altText: A mural painted in graffiti style on a wall.

props.synopsis: An Indigenous teenager died in 2022 after an unmarked police car collided with a motorbike he was riding in Sydney.

title.children: Officer charged over death of teenager who collided with police car in Sydney

image.altText: Concept art showing four warships fanning out in open waters.

props.synopsis: Six large and "optionally crewed" naval vessels heavily armed with missiles will be added to Australia's surface fleet under a dramatic $11 billion reshaping of the navy that will also see the acquisition of 11 new general-purpose frigates to be partly built overseas.

title.children: Heavily armed 'optionally crewed' ships to enter service under reshaping of Australia's naval fleet

image.altText: ANZ and Suncorp logos composite image

props.synopsis: A court overrules the ACCC to approve ANZ's planned $4.9 billion takeover of Suncorp's banking division, BHP's half-year profit plunges 86 per cent on write-downs, and the ASX is fairly flat after Wall Street's holiday. Follow live.

title.children: ANZ shares slide after Suncorp banking takeover approval, BHP profit slumps, ASX trades flat

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Mothballing BHP's Nickel West assets may cost just as much to keep them running
Minutes show RBA considered raising rates this month

image.altText: two bottles of gin side by side

props.synopsis: You might not have noticed, but Australia's biggest liquor retailers are now selling vast numbers of their own private-label wine, beer and pre-mixes. It's leading to concerns about a further concentration of market power.Â

title.children: Major supermarket chain accused of 'deceptive' labelling on homebrand Tasmanian gin

image.altText: A close up photo of a man wearing a suit and tie with short brown hair. He looks serious, and is in his mid-30s.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Country Liberal Party MP Joshua Burgoyne has been charged withÂ careless driving causing serious harmÂ following a traffic accident in Alice Springs in August 2023.

title.children: Police charge Alice Springs MLA Joshua Burgoyne withÂ careless driving causing serious harm

image.altText: an outside view of a row of houses

props.synopsis: Our political leaders have shied away from confronting negative gearing, but encouraging ownership of multiple properties ensures house prices remain out of reach for the next generation, writes Ian Verrender.

title.children: How a tax policy from a bygone era could result in the death of affordable housing

image.altText: A number of illustrations of grocery items, like milk, apples, sausages, around two 'specials' signs 'half price' and '40% off'.

props.synopsis: Four Corners has spoken to insiders, experts, and the supermarket CEOs themselves to find out just how they operate. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Specials, phantom brands, price matching: The shopping list of supermarket tactics you need to know about

image.altText: Path leading to Tree area and mulch fenced off at Bicentennial Park 1, Glebe

props.synopsis: Bicentennial Park, an aged care facility, a parish and a private residence are among new sites that have tested positive for asbestos in Sydney.

title.children: Dangerous asbestos detected at popular Sydney park as more contaminated sites revealed

image.altText: Police commissioner Katarina Carroll addresses the media while dressed in uniform

props.synopsis: KatarinaÂ Carroll was appointed police commissioner in 2019 becoming the first woman to hold the role in Queensland after serving as the commissioner of the Queensland Fire and Emergency Service.

title.children: Queensland's police commissioner outlines huge increase in DV occurrences as she resigns

image.altText: GAP greyhound waiting for adoption

props.synopsis: Coalition for the Protection of Greyhounds research finds many greyhounds are euthanased away from the track after being seriously injured while racing.

title.children: Greyhound protection group calls for federal inquiry into racing after off-track deaths

image.altText: Morwell police station

props.synopsis: Coroner hears David James Dorling complained to custody officers at Dandenong Police Station he had chest pain and said he had taken a large amount of medication.

title.children: Inquest begins into man's death in custody after pleading guilty to child sex abuse offences

image.altText: West Australian Senator Louise Pratt sitting behind a desk in her Perth office holding a pen. Taken 15/07/21

props.synopsis: Louise Pratt announces she is stepping down from politics at the next election, citing health concerns as part of the the reason for her decision.

title.children: Retiring WA senator cites health concerns in decision to step away from politics

image.altText: A scientist testing a pill-like substance.

props.synopsis: Synthetic drugs are circulating in Australia, increasing the risk of overdose and poisoning. Experts say more pill testing could help.Â

title.children: Australians are accidentally taking drugs 100 times stronger than morphine. Is pill testing the answer?

image.altText: Two elderly women sit smiling and holding hands on a couch.

props.synopsis: Terry Phillips's mother, pictured here an hour before her death, was adamant that it was time to go and the Canadian system allowed her to do just that. Her daughter says Australia should consider a similar program.

title.children: Grace didn't have a terminal illness, but she was allowed to die on her own terms

image.altText: The flags of China and the USA are being displayed on a smartphone, with an NVIDIA chip visible in the background.

props.synopsis: A vast technology gap that has eaten deeply into Australia's ability to determine its own pathÂ is now so vast, it has become impossible to bridge, writes Linton Besser.

title.children: ASIC using AI to read submissions to Big Four inquiry

image.altText: A dirt carpark filled with vans next to a beach

props.synopsis: An increasing tide of illegal campers amid an ongoing housing and accommodation crisis causes tensions in WA's surfing heartland, with complaints of a "constant stream of faeces, toilet paper and wet wipes" being left behind.

title.children: Illegal camping leaving Margaret River locals fuming

image.altText: Close up of man holding uncut green gem the size of aa 50-cent piece

props.synopsis: While the sapphire rush of the 1890s is long gone, these modern gem hunters are still eager to strike it lucky and enjoy the colourful lifestyle ofÂ Queensland's Gemfields.

title.children: This whopping sapphire was unearthed in Qld. Meet the gem hunters vying to find more

image.altText: People walk past roadside stalls selling coca cola and sprite, on a dirt road

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea is reeling from a bloody massacre in the Highlands province of Enga, and the bloodshed suggests an armoury of automatic weapons funnelled through powerful community leaders is fuelling the violence.

title.children: PNG police say tribesmen who killed dozens in Enga massacre had M16s, AR15s and shotguns

image.altText: A player catches the ball during a rugby league training session

props.synopsis: Every new NRL season brings a fresh crop of rookie sensations. Nick Campton lists the five young players set to make an impact in 2024.Â

title.children: Meet the five players set to make their mark on the NRL in 2024

image.altText: Tim Stannard stands in front of a lamp and picture in his loung room.

props.synopsis: Tim Stannard says he's had long COVID for four years and can no longer hold down a job. Experts say patients feel let down by the government's response to a parliamentary inquiry into the disease, calling it a "missed opportunity".

title.children: Tim thought he had 'a little flu', but four years later he can no longer hold down a job

image.altText: Satellite images show Rafah's tent city

props.synopsis: The city was once a "safe zone" for displaced Gazans. Now new satellite images reveal the reality of those fleeing the conflict.

title.children: Satellite images of Rafah reveal the reality of more than 1 million people fleeing conflict
